bayern.steinbrecher.gruen2.connection

Class SshConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayern.steinbrecher.gruen2.connection.DBConnection
      • bayern.steinbrecher.gruen2.connection.SshConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class SshConnection
extends DBConnection
    Represents database connections over SSH.
    Author:
    Stefan Huber

    • Constructor Detail

      • SshConnection

        public SshConnection(java.lang.String sshHost,
                     java.lang.String sshUsername,
                     java.lang.String sshPassword,
                     java.lang.String databaseHost,
                     java.lang.String databaseUsername,
                     java.lang.String databasePasswd,
                     java.lang.String databaseName)
              throws com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException
        Constructes a new database connection over SSH.
        Parameters:
        sshHost - The address of the ssh host.
        sshUsername - The username for the ssh connection.
        sshPassword - The password for the ssh connection.
        databaseHost - The address of the database host (without protocol).
        databaseUsername - The username for the database.
        databasePasswd - The password for the database.
        databaseName - The name of the database to connect to.
        Throws:
        com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException - Thrown if some of username, password or host is wrong or not reachable.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Table containing the results AND the headings of each column. First dimension rows; second columns.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if the sql code is invalid.
